position: Summer Internship in Process Automation, Data Analysis or Model Validation
description:
Citi Handlowy is a bank which combines the experience and the best traditions of the Polish banking with a modern model of finance. Citi Handlowy is one of the strongest local banking institution and an integral part of Citi - a leading financial services company, having approximately 200 million customer accounts and operating in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Here at Citi Handlowy we recognize and develop talents by investing in ambitious students and graduates who are not afraid to take on challenges. We follow trends and support the development of our employees by introducing new technologies and providing mobile access to knowledge sharing portals and online databases. If youre enthusiastic, willing to learn and work hand in hand with experienced professionals, we invite you to take part in our Summer Internship Program within Process Automation, Data Analysis or Model Validation areas . The internship starts in July 1st with an Orientation Day - training of essential skills as well as comprehensive orientation to Citis culture. Afterwards, you will join your individual team to work on your business assignments till September 15th . During the Summer Internship you will be exposed to a variety of roles to help you understand the business and build your portfolio of professional skills. You will have the possibility to work in one of the following business areas: Operations and Technology, Corporate or Consumer Banking, Risk Management, Compliance and Finance. Process Automation area includes: understanding and reviewing processes creating, testing and implementing tools supporting processes automation Data Analysis area includes: creating and administrating of databases analyzing data and proposing its usage for the needs of current tasks and projects Model Validation area includes: understanding, monitoring and testing current models suggesting and implementing alternative solutions What we expect: full-time availability form July 1st do September 15th at least a second year student (by June 2021) of: IT, Quantitative Methods, Mathematics, Econometrics, Economics, STEM, Finance or related very good MS Office skills (especially MS Excel including macros and MS Access) one of: SAS, VBA, SQL strong analytical and problem-solving mindset demonstrating clear professional interest, proactivity and self-motivation good command of English (minimum B2 level) What we offer: possibility to gain globally appreciated work experience support in professional development constant support from your assigned buddy contract of employment attractive benefits, including health care and Multisport possibility to continue your career within Citi after the internship If you are particularly interested in a specific area, you can add a comment in your CV. Your preference will be taken into consideration. Join us and apply now! DESCRIPTION

Please Note - Relocation may be required to Seattle, WA.

Do you want to shape the future of virtualized (SDN) networking in the world€™s biggest public cloud?

The Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) VPC data plane team is building a system to power the network that runs right beneath all our customer's EC2 VPC instances, adding features like firewalling (security groups), billing and monitoring as we touch every single packet on every single host across our massive worldwide fleet. Our vision is to combine the performance of bare metal networking while maintaining all the benefits of the cloud, including delivering features not possible on bare metal i.e. true Software Defined Networking (SDN).

We are growing fast, and are looking for C programmers who can deliver ultra-high performance code - our goal is to be processing many millions of packets per second on embedded CPU cores. This requires both being able to implement highly optimized data structures, but also low level tuning to our hardware. If you have good experience in C/C++, and a passion for systems software engineering such as kernel or embedded development, then this is a unique opportunity to join us in building the platform which is the basis for all new EC2 VPC features in the years to come.

Your responsibilities will include:
- Innovating and delivering creative SW Designs to develop new services, solve operational problems, drive improvements in developer velocity, or positively impact operational safety
- Writing requirements capturing documents, design documents, integration test plans, and deployment plans
- Communicating status and progress of deliverables to schedule
- Sharing learnings and innovations with your team and stakeholders

DESCRIPTION

Are you excited to solve problems at the cutting edge of cloud computing? Do you want to build and own services providing some of the key features at the core of Amazon's Elastic Cloud Compute (EC2) infrastructure? Do you want to work hard, have fun, and make history? If so come work for us in EC2 Networking!
EC2 Networking is crucial for Amazon€™s long-term success as a technology services company. It is the future of Amazon, and we are rapidly expanding our team to meet our fast growing needs. The EC2 Networking team is looking for talented software engineers to help us build new innovative features driving the future of cloud computing, and the tools to help us operate in this space.
We are growing fast, and are looking for C programmers who can deliver ultra-high performance code - our goal is to be processing many millions of packets per second on embedded CPU cores. This requires both being able to implement highly optimized data structures, but also low level tuning to our hardware. If you have good experience in C/C++, and a passion for systems software engineering such as kernel or embedded development, then this is a unique opportunity to join us in building the platform which is the basis for all new EC2 VPC features in the years to come.

Your responsibilities will include:
- Innovating and delivering creative SW Designs to develop new services, solve operational problems, drive improvements in developer velocity, or positively impact operational safety
- Writing requirements capturing documents, design documents, integration test plans, and deployment plans
- Communicating status and progress of deliverables to schedule
- Sharing learnings and innovations with your team and stakeholders

**Software Engineering Intern, PowerStore, Data Path**

**Location: St. Petersburg, Russia**


Dell provides the technology that transforms the way we all work and live. But we are more than a technology company we are a people company. We inspire, challenge and respect every one of our over 100,000 employees. We also provide them with unparalleled growth and development opportunities. We cant wait for you to discover this for yourself.


**General Summary**


An intern in this position will work on different kinds of tasks related to PowerStore data path implementation. PowerStore family eliminates traditional tradeoffs in performance, scalability, and storage efficiency, with a data-centric, intelligent, and adaptable infrastructure that transforms and mobilizes both traditional and modern workloads. PowerStores single architecture for block, file, and VMware vVols leverages the latest technologies to support an enterprise-class variety of traditional and modern workloads from relational databases to ERP and EMR apps, cloud-native applications, and file-based workloads such as content repositories and home directories. The ability to accommodate application, multi-protocol network, and multi-format storage diversity (physical and virtual volumes, containers, traditional files) within a single 2U appliance provides business-enabling flexibility and helps IT simplify and consolidate their infrastructure.


**Essential Requirements**


+ Ability to communicate effectively in a global enterprise environment.

+ Proficient in C / C++ programming languages.

+ Proficient in algorithms and data structures (hash table, B+ tree).

+ Knowledge of principles of software testing.

+ Intermediate English level.


**Desirable Requirements**


+ Proficient in Python and with Linux based development environment, Github, JIRA. Experience with unit and component testing frameworks.

+ Knowledge of FileSystems, Storage systems (SAN), embedded development, multi-threading programming, real-time.


**Joining Us, You Will Get**


+ Work on a real project. Our interns work on the same projects with our engineers and make their contribution to the development of high-tech leading-edge Dell Technologies products.

+ Paid internship. Students receive a decent salary from the first day of the internship.

+ Excellent career opportunities. 6-month contract with possible extension and offer of a full-time position.

+ Flexible schedule. Students can work 20 to 40 hours per week, depending on their abilities.

Graphics Software Developer (Intern)

Job Description

Intel develops Best-in-Class Graphics Technology that is a critical part of our major silicon chip product lines. Intel's Graphics Architecture Team is responsible for architecting the core graphics technology that is featured in these products. Key to successfully architecting these products is capturing traces and analyzing modern AAA 3D games and their graphics API usage. This may require implementing custom capture tools as well as developing proxy workloads that isolate innovative graphics API use cases expected in next generation 3D games. We are looking for a Graphics Software Developer Intern to join our team.

Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:

  • Implement specific capture and tools and methodologies for graphics and gaming workloads.
  • Leverage existing graphics tools and extension APIs to those tools such as Microsoft Pix or Intel Graphics Performance Analyzers (GPA).
  • Implement specific graphics workloads, or augment existing graphics workloads to create specific graphics architecture stress tests.


Qualifications

Minimum Skills and Experience


Must be enrolled and working toward Bachelorâ€™s Degree in Computer Science, Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE) or equivalent.

Candidate should also have 3+ months of educational or experience in the following:

  • C/C++ programming skills.
  • Experience with at least one modern graphics APIs such as DirectX11, DirectX12, OpenGLÂ or Vulkan.
  • Knowledge or interest in modern 3D game development.
  • Software Performance analytical skills.

Â 

Preferred Skills and Experience


An ideal candidate will have knowledge and/or experience in some of the following:

  • Undergraduate graphics/rendering coursework.
  • Additional useful languages may include C# Â and python.
  • Experience implementing 3D game technology, or game engine programming such Epic Unreal, Unity3D, or similar.
  • Experience with modern 3D analysis tools such as Pix or Intel GPA.
  • Experience with modern texture map formats/concepts including Block Compressed textures (BC1-BC7), MiP Map generation, and texture filtering.

position: Mission Systems - 3 month Software Summer internship
description:
This post is for a Summer **Mission Systems** **Intern** to work within the **Engineering** function in Boeing Defence UK (BDUK) in **Bristol** . BDUK is a subsidiary of the Boeing Company and currently employs over 1,200 people in the UK. BDUK is responsible for delivering several exciting contracts to our UK defence customers including E-7 AEW&C, P-8A Maritime Patrol Aircraft, C4ISR Services, and Through Life Support for the Chinook & Apache Fleets, Logistic Information Services and Training Services


The role will be part of a hands-on software engineering Summer Internship, normally over a period of **3 months** . It will be both challenging and exciting for a student at University. The candidate will be expected to put their skills to the test and make a real contribution in order to successfully shape and demonstrate complex software solutions to our customers.


**Position Responsibilities:**

Software engineering:


+ Supporting the Mission Systems Team in the implementation and test of concept demonstration and prototype solutions using C++, Java, web-based visualization languages, as well as using open source libraries and scripting languages.

+ Using the BDUK Mission Systems Agile Software development process and toolset to implement and test software solutions.


**Employer will not sponsor applicants for employment visa status.**


**Basic Qualifications (Required Skills/Experience):**


Undergraduate in Computer Science or numerate subject


**Preferred Qualifications (Desired Skills/Experience):**


Agile Software Development experience


**Typical Education & Experience:**


Undergraduate in computer science, with experience and interest in agile software development activities


**Relocation:**

This position does not offer relocation. Candidates must live in the immediate area or relocate at their own expense.

position: Summer Internship: Systems Engineering (Junior / Senior / Post Grad)
description:
Raytheon Intelligence and Space (RIS) has an exciting opportunity for a Systems Engineering Intern with strong academic fundamentals to join our skilled team located in Dulles, VA. As a Systems Engineering Student Intern, the candidate will support engineering activities and senior engineers on programs to include activities related to requirement analysis and hierarchical decomposition, development of system architecture, and system delivery.


Responsibilities Include:




+ Correction and updating of technical documents


+ Contributions to presentations


+ Supporting design reviews


+ Supporting customer requests for information


+ Supporting the configuration, equipment and software changes to satisfy requests to system integration and test support


+ Applying your engineering knowledge and participating as a member of a multi-discipline team


+ Following established SE processes and procedures


+ End of summer intern presentation




Requirements:




+ Fundamental engineering skills


+ Excellent leadership and verbal/written communication skills


+ Proficiency in Windows and/or Linux


+ Working knowledge of Microsoft Office applications


+ Professional self-starter harboring a positive attitude


+ Willingness to learn program/organizational processes and procedures and ability to professionally engage with all levels of staffing


+ This position requires the ability to access systems that contain information restricted to US Citizens based on certain Federal Government contractual requirements.




Desired Requirements:




+ Previous intern experience


+ Coursework in modern application architectures or methodologies, aerospace engineering and systems engineering


+ Technical writing exposure through coursework or experience


+ Ability to work in a team environment


+ Experience working with Interface Control Definition (ICD)


+ Programming skills C++ and/or Java/J2EE


+ Course work in requirements analysis, development, traceability and verification




Education Requirements:




+ Candidate must be enrolled in an accredited college or university, pursing a technical degree in Engineering (Aeronautical, Computer Engineering, Electrical, Mechanical, Software or Systems), Computer Science or a closely related STEM field. Please include your transcript with your resume.


+ This position can be for a Junior, Senior or Post Graduate based on the candidate's qualifications, including degree credits earned.


+ ST03 (TechStudent-Junior)
Junior status must have completed 60-89 hours of college credits towards degree and obtained Junior status as of Summer 2021.


+ ST04 (TechStudent-Senior)
Senior status must have completed 90+ hours of college credits towards degree and obtained Senior status as of Summer 2021.


+ ST05 (TechStudent-PostGraduate) Post Graduate status - must be currently pursuing a Master's or PhD degree and obtained Post Graduate status as of Summer 2021.




This position requires either a U.S. Person or a Non-U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization.

Software Engineer - Intern

Job Description

Flex Solutions is an internal consulting group supporting Intel's product group with software engineering resources with specialized skills to help meet Intel goals. You will have opportunities to participate in various projects as part of product development or research.

The focus of this role will be on system-level software development in areas such as: OS kernel, firmware development, graphics or memory area simulation/validation I/O driver development, imaging/media development, machine learning, computer vision development and optimization, among others.

As an Intern in Flex, you will be assigned to a project to make high contributions to the project while learning new skills and growing your professional network. Management will work with you to prioritize projects that align with your skills and areas of interest.

We are looking for candidates with solid communication and core software engineering skills who can work with domain experts to understand requirements and then propose and implement software solutions. The ideal candidate will not know everything, but they will apply their current knowledge to new areas and will be flexible and open to learn new skills.

The ideal candidate should also have the following behavioral traits:

  • Strong written/oral communication.

  • Teamwork.

  • Time management skills.


Qualifications

You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Experience listed below would be obtained through a combination of your school work/research and/or relevant previous job and/or internship experiences.

Education:

  • Must be pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical/Electronics Engineering or any other related field.


Minimum Qualifications:

Understanding or coursework inÂ the following:

  • C/C++ programming, assembly languages, data structures, algorithms, Python or Java.
  • Embedded systems, microcontrollers, CPU architecture.
  • OS/RTOS Kernels, multi-threading programming, memory and resource management.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Understanding or coursework in version control and continuous integration tools.

This position is not eligible for employment-based visa/immigration sponsorship.Â  Intel sponsors individuals for employment-based visas for positions where we experience a shortage of US Workers. These skills shortage roles are typically STEM contributing positions requiring a Master's or PhD degree, or a Bachelorâ€™s degree with three yearsâ€™ related Â job experience.Â  This position does not qualify for Intel Sponsorship because it is either (1) a non-STEM contributing position, or (2) a STEM position that only requires a Bachelorâ€™s degree and less than three yearsâ€™ experience. Â 

Inside this Business Group

Intel's Information Technology Group (IT) designs, deploys and supports the information technology architecture and hardware/software applications for Intel. This includes the LAN, WAN, telephony, data centers, client PCs, backup and restore, and enterprise applications. IT is also responsible for e-Commerce development, data hosting and delivery of Web content and services.

USInternJR0151600Phoenix

DESCRIPTION

Do you want to shape the future of virtualized (SDN) networking in the world€™s biggest public cloud?
The Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) VPC control plane team is building a new system to power the network that runs right beneath all our customer's EC2 VPC instances, adding features like firewalling (security groups), billing and monitoring as we touch every single packet on every single host across our massive worldwide fleet. Our vision is to combine the performance of bare metal networking while maintaining all the benefits of the cloud, including delivering features not possible on bare metal i.e. true Software Defined Networking (SDN).
We are growing fast, and are looking for Java programmers who can help build a large distributed service which powers EC2 VPC. If you are interested in building control planes or microservices we'd love to talk to you!
Your responsibilities will include:
- Innovating and delivering creative SW Designs to develop new services, solve operational problems, drive improvements in developer velocity, or positively impact operational safety
- Writing requirements capturing documents, design documents, integration test plans, and deployment plans
- Communicating status and progress of deliverables to schedule
- Sharing learnings and innovations with your team and stakeholders

DESCRIPTION

Do you want to shape the future of virtualized (SDN) networking in the world€™s biggest public cloud?
The Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) VPC data plane team is building a new system to power the network that runs right beneath all our customer's EC2 VPC instances, adding features like firewalling (security groups), billing and monitoring as we touch every single packet on every single host across our massive worldwide fleet. Our vision is to combine the performance of bare metal networking while maintaining all the benefits of the cloud, including delivering features not possible on bare metal i.e. true Software Defined Networking (SDN).
We are growing fast, and are looking for C programmers who can deliver ultra-high performance code - our goal is to be processing many millions of packets per second on embedded CPU cores. This requires both being able to implement highly optimized data structures, but also low level tuning to our hardware. If you have good experience in C/C++, and a passion for systems software engineering such as kernel or embedded development, then this is a unique opportunity to join us in building the platform which is the basis for all new EC2 VPC features in the years to come.

Your responsibilities will include:
- Innovating and delivering creative SW Designs to develop new services, solve operational problems, drive improvements in developer velocity, or positively impact operational safety
- Writing requirements capturing documents, design documents, integration test plans, and deployment plans
- Communicating status and progress of deliverables to schedule
- Sharing learnings and innovations with your team and stakeholders

DESCRIPTION

Do opportunities to work on ambiguous and never-solved-before problems excite you?
Are you interested in scaling challenges that are constantly evolving?
Would you like to *really* contribute, both technically and as a leader in a team?
The Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) Networking team is looking for software engineers who have a passion for diving deep while also being able to see the big picture. We are re-engineering our virtual networking control plane as part of Amazon€™s initiative to get EC2 performance to be as close as possible to that of bare metal. This role would involve being part of the team that owns building, scaling, and maintaining high performance software to streamline the management of millions of Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) configurations.
If you are a Software Engineer with a strong background coding in JAVA/C, a passion for improving quality, solving challenging problems and curiosity about virtual networking, then this is your opportunity to own major deliverables and all aspects of the development cycle: scoping, design, implementation, and testing. You will be encouraged to exercise judgment in proactively determining and recommending the best features, designs, and support models based on business objectives, timelines, and resource constraints.
Your responsibilities will include:
- Innovating and delivering creative software Designs to develop new services, solve operational problems, drive improvements in developer velocity, or positively impact operational safety
- Writing requirements capturing documents, design documents, integration test plans, and deployment plans
- Communicating status and progress of deliverables to schedule
- Sharing learnings and innovations with your team and stakeholders

DESCRIPTION

Please Note: Relocation is required either to Seattle, WA or Palo Alto, CA.

Are you interested in building hyper-scale database services in the cloud? Do you want to revolutionize the way databases are built for the cloud? Do you want to have direct and immediate impact on hundreds of thousands of users who use AWS database services?
Amazon Aurora offers MySQL and Postgres compatible, relational database engines that combine the speed and availability of high-end commercial databases with the simplicity and cost-effectiveness of open source databases. It provides up to five times better performance than MySQL, up to twice the performance of PostgreSQL, all at a price point one tenth that of a commercial database while delivering similar performance and availability.

Amazon Aurora Engine teams are looking for software developers who are passionate about databases and large-scale storage system technologies, and excited about building database systems that run across thousands of servers across multiple datacenters worldwide. These are core systems development positions where you will grow to own the design and development of significant system software components critical to our industry leading database services architected for the cloud.
We are looking for candidates who are exceptional in systems programming, data structures and algorithms, and advanced databases. Research and hands-on experience working in database research groups and labs is preferred. You not only need to be a top software developer with a good academic and/or research track record, but also need to excel in communication and leadership. This is a unique and rare opportunity to get in on the ground floor within a fast-growing business and help shape the technology and the product.

position: Sr Product Manager - Technical, International Expansion
description:
DESCRIPTION

Looking for an opportunity to move fast and make a global impact? Want to help take our €˜everything store€™ to customers and sellers in countries where there is no Amazon today?

The International Expansions (IE) organization€™s charter is to rapidly expand Amazon€™s retail presence globally, partnering closely with category management, business, technology, and product teams across Amazon, to deliver the world€™s largest selection to customers around the globe. Within IE organization, our team's vision is to bring Amazon to customers in 150+ countries around the world and build the tools and features that enable our selling partners to go global effortlessly, as well as drive customer engagement and ensure our success in emerging regions and countries.

We are looking for an experienced Product Manager - Technical to drive the product roadmap and own the design, development and implementation of Amazon€™s core shopping experience and capabilities, in new regions and countries around the world. As a successful candidate, you will have experience managing complex business and technical challenges, and have the ability to influence and successfully drive initiatives forward. You will have a strong bias toward data driven decision making, passion for innovating and problem solving and an innate ability to understand how metrics relate to business problems and to each other.

You are able to synthesize a variety of technologies and capabilities, and translate them into tools and intelligence that solve specific pain-points. You are analytical and data driven, and are laser focused on measuring and improving the success of products you own. You are adept at working across cross-disciplinary teams, making hard choices, and ensuring complete visibility of your product to stakeholders. You should be comfortable with a degree of ambiguity that€™s higher than most projects and relish the idea of solving challenging problems.

Key Responsibilities:
· Build, develop and manage the product roadmap for initiatives/features enhancing customer experience - define product vision, business requirements and strategies supported by internal and external analysis.
· Drive product development across teams (primarily Engineering, Operations, Product Management, Business Development, and Marketing) through business requirements, design, implementation, and deployment.
· Work with the leadership team to set strategy, define the product, and make appropriate high-judgment trade-offs between features and speed-to-launch
· Engage with service owners and partner teams to identify integration opportunities and drive product initiatives
· Anticipate bottlenecks, manage risk and escalations, and balance the business needs versus technical constraints.
· Proactively identify and resolve issues that may impair the team€™s ability to meet strategic, product, and technical goals
· Make prioritization and trade-off decisions balancing the user experience, developer experience, and business value.
· Investigate issues from different sources, do root cause analysis, identify systemic gaps and ensure these gaps are addressed.

position: Intern - Global Industry and Value Advisor Analyst Job
description:
Requisition ID: 271186
Work Area: Administration
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Student
Employment Type: Intern

COMPANY DESCRIPTION


SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. Thats why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because its the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve peoples lives.

 

Contract Duration: 6 to 12 months

 

Contract Hours: 40 hours per week

 

Anticipated Start Date: February 2021

 

Office Location: Virtual USA

 

Purpose & Objective of Position

 

The Industry and Value Advisory (IVA) organization is chartered with articulating the value and business case of adopting SAP Solutions and differentiating SAP as the innovation partner of choice.

 

Global IVA team is responsible for creating and disseminating value content for SAPs portfolio, building content and thought leadership, incubating and scaling organizational best practices, driving enablement across field-facing organization, and driving other key global value-focused programs.  All with a strong focus on creating value and industry content/programs for our field and customers. The intern is expected to support various initiatives of the Global and Industry Advisory team and will be working closely with the Global Industry and Value Advisory leadership team.

 

Expectations & Tasks

 

The intern is expected to support the team with various tasks. See examples of tasks, although not limited to:

  • Independently conduct research
  • Support with executive communication, e.g. research communication channels and target audience
  • Support the team in creation of various pieces of content, e.g. blogs, value papers etc.
  • Attend meetings and help with action items/follow up
  • Drive and support enablement programs e.g. help organize trainings and meetings.
  • Maintain and update the Global IVA jam site (SAP internal intranet)
  • Support coordinating the creation of value stories (e.g. help coordinate the process and write stories)
  • Help drive and update various processes for the team
  • Various ad hoc and administrative tasks

 

Skills / Competencies

 

  • Ability to analyze data and research using various sources
  • A collaborator who can work with a global team virtually
  • Great communication skills (oral and written)
  • A self-starter and independent thinker who can run with various tasks
  • A high level of integrity, accuracy and dependability
  • Curiosity to learn and a desire to bring fresh thinking/innovation to the team

 

Educational Requirements

 

  • Must be actively enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate program at an accredited university
  • Preferred: Business / Economics / Technology / Communications / Strategy background
  • Open to other academic backgrounds as well

 

Qualifications

 

  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Applications (Teams, Excel, Word and PowerPoint)
  • Previous work experience preferred

 

WHAT YOU GET FROM US

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If youre searching for a company thats dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment apply now.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas:Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.comorCareers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ:Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA:Careers@sap.com).

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

Additional Locations:Virtual - USA


Nearest Major Market: Philadelphia

Software Engineer Intern

Job Description

IT Internships are a unique opportunity to combine your studies with practical experience in system engineering of cutting edge enterprise IT technologies. You will gain a deep understanding of design, development, and integration of complex systems.

During the Internship you will get real-world experience with ownership of projects from day one, as well as the opportunity to develop a network of contacts for your future.

Flex Engineering is an internal software engineering consulting organization that works with product groups across Intel on cutting-edge technologies. Flex's charter is to help Intel move faster on the most important and impactful projects such as: Autonomous Driving, Virtual Reality, 5G, Artificial Intelligence, Cloud, IoT, and Memory.

The focus of this role is on system-level software development in areas such as: Linux/Windows OS kernel, Firmware, Library/Middleware, optimization, graphics or memory area simulation/validation I/O driver, imaging/media, AI/Machine learning, and Computer Vision, among others.

As an Intern in Flex, you will be assigned to a project to make high contributions to the project while learning new skills and growing your professional network. Management will work with you to prioritize projects that align with your skills and areas of interest.

We are looking for candidates with solid communication and core software engineering skills who can work with domain experts to understand requirements and then propose and implement software solutions. The ideal candidate will not know everything, but they will be apply their knowledge to new areas and will be flexible and open to learn new skills.

The ideal candidate should also have the following behavioral traits:

  • Strong written/oral communication.
  • Teamwork.
  • Time management skills.


Qualifications

You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Experience listed below would be obtained through a combination of your school work/research and/or relevant previous job and/or internship experiences.

Education:

  • Must be pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering or any other related field.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Understanding or coursework in C/C++ programming, data structures, algorithms.
  • Understanding or coursework in OS/RTOS Kernels, multi-threading programming, memory and resource management.
  • Understanding or coursework in version control and continuous integration tools.


Preferred Qualifications:

  • Understanding of embedded systems, microcontrollers, CPU architecture.
  • Linux Kernel, Device Drivers, RTOS, Open Source, embedded software development.
  • Low-level Virtual Platforms for HW/SW simulation.
  • Other programming languages such as Python, Java, Bash, assembly.
  • Machine Learning Frameworks.
  • Parallel/Graphics Compute development.
  • FPGA, Verilog, OpenCL or RTL Design.
Inside this Business Group

Intel's Information Technology Group (IT) designs, deploys and supports the information technology architecture and hardware/software applications for Intel. This includes the LAN, WAN, telephony, data centers, client PCs, backup and restore, and enterprise applications. IT is also responsible for e-Commerce development, data hosting and delivery of Web content and services.

position: 2021 Software Development Engineer Intern - AWS Region Services (WAS,IAD,SEA)
description:
DESCRIPTION


Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world leader in providing a highly reliable, scalable, low-cost infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers hundreds of thousands of businesses in 190 countries around the world!

The Team: We work on the tools that help AWS build more regions faster. We get to learn something about every single one of the AWS service offerings.

We need Developers who move fast, are capable of breaking down and solving complex problems, and have a strong will to get things done. Developers at Amazon work on real world problems on a global scale, own their systems end to end and influence the direction of our technology that impacts hundreds of millions customers around the world.

This role will be based in either Herndon,VA, Arlington, VA or Seattle, WA.

Join a team of super smart, customer obsessed Developers that like to have fun in a start-up like environment.

**Intern Software Quality Engineer, Single Page Web Application**


Join us as an Intern Software Quality Engineer on our Single Page Web Application team in St. Petersburg to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact.


**What youll achieve**


As part of our world class design and engineering team, you will be responsible to convert the requirements and design documents into a set of testing cases and scripts. Our QA Intern you should be a strong team player with initiative and self-motivation, familiar with development, software testing and test automation, who is ready to study and investigate independently and together with mentor\coach.


Dell EMC Server & Infrastructure Systems division, PowerEdge Server Group is the worldwide market leader with servers in small, medium and large size enterprises including Fortune 100 list companies. These solutions increase performance, efficiency, and business agility, helping customers accelerate their IT transformation to meet the new demands of virtualization and the cloud. Our team in St. Petersburg, Russia is working on advanced, intelligent Sales Deal Creation and Acceleration platform in an area of high value workloads for server refresh and scale-out.


**You will:**


+ Review requirements, specifications and technical design documents to provide timely and meaningful feedback.

+ Create and execute test cases and End-to-End tests.

+ Identify, record, document thoroughly and track defects (bugs).

+ Design, develop and run automation scripts using open source tools (approaches researching).

+ Perform thorough regression testing when bugs are resolved.


**Take the first step towards your dream career**


Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Heres what we are looking for with this role:


**Essential Requirements**


+ Pursuing a Bachelors or Masters Degree in Computer Science or Information Technology or equivalent related experience. Work experience in a relevant industry would be plus.

position: Summer Internship in Process Automation, Data Analysis or Model Validation
description:
Citi Handlowy is a bank which combines the experience and the best traditions of the Polish banking with a modern model of finance. Citi Handlowy is one of the strongest local banking institution and an integral part of Citi - a leading financial services company, having approximately 200 million customer accounts and operating in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Here at Citi Handlowy we recognize and develop talents by investing in ambitious students and graduates who are not afraid to take on challenges. We follow trends and support the development of our employees by introducing new technologies and providing mobile access to knowledge sharing portals and online databases. If youre enthusiastic, willing to learn and work hand in hand with experienced professionals, we invite you to take part in our Summer Internship Program within Process Automation, Data Analysis or Model Validation areas . The internship starts in July 1st with an Orientation Day - training of essential skills as well as comprehensive orientation to Citis culture. Afterwards, you will join your individual team to work on your business assignments till September 15th . During the Summer Internship you will be exposed to a variety of roles to help you understand the business and build your portfolio of professional skills. You will have the possibility to work in one of the following business areas: Operations and Technology, Corporate or Consumer Banking, Risk Management, Compliance and Finance. Process Automation area includes: understanding and reviewing processes creating, testing and implementing tools supporting processes automation Data Analysis area includes: creating and administrating of databases analyzing data and proposing its usage for the needs of current tasks and projects Model Validation area includes: understanding, monitoring and testing current models suggesting and implementing alternative solutions What we expect: full-time availability form July 1st do September 15th at least a second year student (by June 2021) of: IT, Quantitative Methods, Mathematics, Econometrics, Economics, STEM, Finance or related very good MS Office skills (especially MS Excel including macros and MS Access) one of: SAS, VBA, SQL strong analytical and problem-solving mindset demonstrating clear professional interest, proactivity and self-motivation good command of English (minimum B2 level) What we offer: possibility to gain globally appreciated work experience support in professional development constant support from your assigned buddy contract of employment attractive benefits, including health care and Multisport possibility to continue your career within Citi after the internship If you are particularly interested in a specific area, you can add a comment in your CV. Your preference will be taken into consideration. Join us and apply now! Collins Aerospace, a Raytheon Technologies company, is a leader in technologically advanced and intelligent solutions for the global aerospace and defense industry. Collins Aerospace has the capabilities, comprehensive portfolio and expertise to solve customers toughest challenges and to meet the demands of a rapidly evolving global market.




Collins Aerospace makes modern flight possible. Of course, that wouldnt be possible without the capabilities and technologies of our organization, as well as our engineers a highly skilled, accomplished network that spans more than 180 sites, 24 countries and 6 Strategic Business Units (SBUs).




Our industry-leading experts are setting the standards for the aerospace industry and paving the way for the future. But as new challenges present themselves, we need fresh, creative and motivated minds to overcome these hurdles, help us break barriers and achieve new levels of innovation.




In January 2021, Collins Aerospace will be expanding a new Global Engineering Center (GEC) facility in Puerto Rico, with plans to hire up to 250 employees over the next 5 years at our Aguadilla site.




Join our growing engineering team in Puerto Rico, where you will provide critical support to Collins SBUs including our Mission Systems and Power & Controls teams working on exciting programs and projects ranging from the development of the next generation of advanced concept ejection seats to the latest technologies for the U.S. warfighter.




Do you have what it takes to be a part of a global, diverse organization that doesnt shy away from big opportunities? If so, we invite you to join our ranks and create the next generation of aerospace technologies.




Together, we will nurture an engineering culture that values intellectual curiosity, risk takers and integrity. A place where we will challenge ourselves, our teams and the status quo, and where we will work to find a way the right way to achieve what others can only dream of.




Primary Responsibilities: Conducts engineering processes and standard work, including verification and qualification procedures. Compiles and consolidates testing on diagnostic systems containing logical and mathematical solutions. Assists in conducting disciplinary research on one or more stages of the equipment design phase to develop design options and recommendations. Learns hardware and software standards and ensures work product adheres to these standards and business objectives of the organization are met. Designs, develops, documents, tests and debugs control and diagnostic systems that contain logical and mathematical solutions. Conducts multidisciplinary research and collaborates with equipment designers in the planning, design, development, and utilization of electronic data processing systems for product and commercial software. Determines end user needs by analyzing system capabilities to resolve problems on program intent, output requirements and input data acquisition. Ensures hardware and software standards are met. Designs and implements build procedures that are used to support hardware and software product development and use. May develop software configuration standards for company-wide use. May train software developers in the use of configuration management tools and the implementation of software quality standards. Includes control modeling (model based design).




Basic Qualifications:



+ Requires a High School Diploma or equivalent and student must be pursuing a Bachelor's or advanced degree in an applicable discipline.


+ Must be a U.S. Citizen





Nothing matters more to Collins Aerospace than our strong ethical and safety commitments. As such, all U.S. positions require a background check, which may include a drug screen.




Note:



+ Background check and drug screen required (every external new hire in the U.S.)


+ Drug Screen only performed on re-hires who have been gone for more than 1 year





Diversity drives innovation; inclusion drives success. We believe a multitude of approaches and ideas enable us to deliver the best results for our workforce, workplace, and customers. We are committed to fostering a culture where all employees can share their passions and ideas so we can tackle the toughest challenges in our industry and pave new paths to limitless possibility.




WE ARE REDEFINING AEROSPACE.




At Collins, the paths we pave together lead to limitless possibility. And the bonds we form with our customers and with each other -- propel us all higher, again and again.

































Apply now and be part of the team thats redefining aerospace, every day.

SSD Media System Engineer Graduate Intern

Job Description

This position is associated with the sale of Intelâ€™s NAND memory and storageâ€¯business to SK hynix (You can read more about the transaction in the press release - https://newsroom.intel.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/11/2020/10/nand-memory-news-q-a.pdf). The transaction will enhance the resources and potential of the businessâ€™ storage solutions, including client and enterprise SSDs, in the rapidly growing NAND Flash space amid the era of big data.  

This is an exciting time to be at Intel - come join our Media System IP Pathfinding as a Media System engineer and work on the most advanced 3DNAND and SSD technology in the world. As the global leader in the semiconductor industry, Intel possesses industry-leading SSD technology and the most capable Triple Level Cell (TLC) & Quadruple Level Cell (QLC) NAND Flash products. As a Media System Engineer, you will be part of a world-class team that will transition to lead the SSD business at SK Hynix.

This position aligns to Phase 1 of the transaction, which includes the 3DNAND enterprise and client SSD business. Phase 1 is expected to close in late 2021, subject to regulatory approvals and other customary conditions. At deal close, all employees aligned to this phase of the transaction will transition to SK Hynix.

In this position, you will be working as part of the Media-Systems engineering team within Intel's Non-Volatile Memory Solutions Group (NSG) to architect, design, and implement integrated system solutions to manage the interactions between Solid State Drive (SSD) system hardware/software and NAND Flash memory components. This job requires you to develop and productize optimized system solutions for SSD product to meet performance and reliability requirements, utilizing formal education and engineering judgment.

Your responsibilities will include but not be limited to:

  • Evaluate and characterize storage media component behavior within SSD systems

  • Design and utilize simulation software that models SSD performance and behavior

  • Lead media-system feature pathfinding efforts to maintain competitive edge on enterprise SSDs features roadmap

  • Implement and characterize proof-of-concept firmware prototypes to evaluate competing algorithms for a given media issue

  • Develop new media management system features through cross-function collaboration with component circuit design, ASIC design and SSD firmware architecture teams

The ideal candidate should exhibit the following behavioral traits:

  • Communication and interpersonal skills to work effectively both independently and in a team across multiple sites

  • Quantitative, analytical, and problem solving skills, problem/conflict resolution skills


Qualifications

You must possess the minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Relevant experience can be obtained through school work, classes and project work, internships, military training, and/ or work experience.

Minimum Requirements:

  • The candidate must be pursuing a MS or PhD degree in Computer Engineering/Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or related fields

  • Minimum 6+ months of experience in software programming, debugging

  • Experience in computer architecture design and systems engineering

  • Experience in embedded systems design and optimization

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with Solid State Drive or other embedded system firmware development using C/C++

  • Experience in modeling complex systems using Transaction Level Modeling using System C or similar technology

  • Experience in NAND Flash or other memory technology

Inside this Business Group

Non-Volatile Solutions Memory Group:Â  The Non-Volatile Memory Solutions Group is a worldwide organization that delivers NAND flash memory products for use in Solid State Drives (SSDs), portable memory storage devices, digital camera memory cards, and other devices.Â  The group is responsible for NVM technology design and development, complete Solid State Drive (SSD) system hardware and firmware development, as well as wafer and SSD manufacturing.

Raytheon Technologies (RTX) offers an innovative and inclusive culture; welcoming diversity and collaboration and providing numerous opportunities for career growth.

This team develops, models, and assesses solution architectures to solve our customers most challenging missions. We are responsible for System of System architecture development; advanced threat assessment; modeling and simulation of solutions within campaign, mission, and system level scenarios; assessment and evaluation of solution performance; prototyping and evaluation of advanced technologies within solution architectures; advanced Concept of Operations (CONOPS) development and visualization; and bringing RMD solutions to customer LVC environments. Dell provides the technology that transforms the way we all work and live. But we are more than a technology company we are a people company. **General Summary**


An intern in this position will work on different kinds of tasks related to PowerStore data path implementation. PowerStore family eliminates traditional tradeoffs in performance, scalability, and storage efficiency, with a data-centric, intelligent, and adaptable infrastructure that transforms and mobilizes both traditional and modern workloads. PowerStores single architecture for block, file, and VMware vVols leverages the latest technologies to support an enterprise-class variety of traditional and modern workloads from relational databases to ERP and EMR apps, cloud-native applications, and file-based workloads such as content repositories and home directories. The ability to accommodate application, multi-protocol network, and multi-format storage diversity (physical and virtual volumes, containers, traditional files) within a single 2U appliance provides business-enabling flexibility and helps IT simplify and consolidate their infrastructure.

position: Technology - Associate Software Engineer (6-month to 1 year internship)
description:
Accenture Technology continues to spearhead its role in elevating market efficiency. This is your opportunity to be a part of these exciting times. Come and join us if you are:
Excited and looking forward to the next stage of technology revolution
Passionate in technologies and striving to make a difference with the aid of automation
Interested to make an impact to the society by helping industry-leaders elevating their business efficiency
Enjoying to be in the community of great and enthusiastic people who share goals and accomplishments
Striving to perform, inspire, progress and achieve more

Associate Software Engineer (6-month to 1 year internship)

A Software Engineering Associate assists in the development, delivery and management of technology-based business solutions. Exposure to coding, testing and implementing configuration changes and assisting in the design of software applications to meet both functional and technical requirements.

Key responsibilities include:
Supporting the technical design process by participating in the analysis of technical application requirements
Assisting in implementing analyses that will identify requirements related to people, processes and technology
Participating in implementing the technical infrastructure, including networks, platforms and servers, enterprise enabling, application enabling, security and operations management
Assisting in the integration of technical and application components to meet business requirements
Coding and testing program modules that meet design specifications; assisting in design
Maintaining, tuning and repairing applications to keep them performing according to technical and functional specifications; providing user support
Participating in execution and documentation of tests necessary to ensure that an application or technical environment meets performance requirements
Executing conversion plans and document possible improvements; identifying disruptions in the processes
Learning from the Internship
Participate in our projects and work with some of the most established companies in Hong Kong
Gain business knowledge about specific industries, and deepen functional know-how
Learn the full solutioning cycle from idea origination to design to solution delivery
Acquire experience in delivering large scale advanced technology solutions
Practice modern delivery methodologies to upgrade delivery skill set

DESCRIPTION

Please Note - Relocation may be required to Seattle, WA.

Do you want to shape the future of virtualized (SDN) networking in the world€™s biggest public cloud?

The Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) VPC data plane team is building a system to power the network that runs right beneath all our customer's EC2 VPC instances, adding features like firewalling (security groups), billing and monitoring as we touch every single packet on every single host across our massive worldwide fleet. Our vision is to combine the performance of bare metal networking while maintaining all the benefits of the cloud, including delivering features not possible on bare metal i.e. true Software Defined Networking (SDN).

We are growing fast, and are looking for C programmers who can deliver ultra-high performance code - our goal is to be processing many millions of packets per second on embedded CPU cores. This requires both being able to implement highly optimized data structures, but also low level tuning to our hardware. If you have good experience in C/C++, and a passion for systems software engineering such as kernel or embedded development, then this is a unique opportunity to join us in building the platform which is the basis for all new EC2 VPC features in the years to come.

Your responsibilities will include:
- Innovating and delivering creative SW Designs to develop new services, solve operational problems, drive improvements in developer velocity, or positively impact operational safety
- Writing requirements capturing documents, design documents, integration test plans, and deployment plans
- Communicating status and progress of deliverables to schedule
- Sharing learnings and innovations with your team and stakeholders

DESCRIPTION

Please note - relocation may be required to Seattle, WA.

Do you want to help build and run a service that is used by millions of customers every day? Are you passionate about highly available and large-scale services? If the answer is yes, the HyperPlane team wants to talk with you. HyperPlane is an AWS core service that offers customers incredibly scalable and robust load balancing technology. We support a number of internal service as well as customer facing products, such as NAT Gateway, Network Load Balancer, Private Link, and many others.

We are growing fast, and are looking for Java programmers who can deliver high quality code, to keep up with the increase in usage of our service. This requires a passion for building ultra-large distributed systems, and the tools necessary to maintain and monitor them. This is a unique opportunity to join us in building the platform which is the basis for many new EC2 VPC features in the years to come.

Your responsibilities will include:
· Innovating and delivering creative SW Designs to develop new services, solve operational problems, drive improvements in developer velocity, or positively impact operational safety
· Writing requirements capturing documents, design documents, integration test plans, and deployment plans
· Communicating status and progress of deliverables, to meet schedules
· Sharing learnings and innovations with your team and stakeholders

About the team

Why should you join the Amazon HyperPlane team?
· We ship software frequently, get fast feedback from real customers around the globe, and see the results of our work come to fruition.
· There are real-world problems to solve that you won€™t find ready-made answers for. For example, how do you ensure customers can scale their application quickly to handle traffic spikes and then back down in a matter of minutes? How do you design a load balancing solution that allows customers to quickly and easily achieve the highest levels of fault tolerance using Amazon EC2?
· We are now designing and building the next generation systems capable of handling massive amounts of data per day, and growing from there. This is a unique opportunity to innovate and build some of the world€™s most resilient large-scale systems from the ground up
· We innovate frequently, and hold ourselves to high standards of service and availability

DESCRIPTION

Please Note - Relocation may be required to Seattle, WA.

AWS Elastic Load Balancing/EC2 Networking is looking for a Software Development Engineer Intern for a critical part of its service that delivers a distributed Network Function Virtualization (NFV) platform. This team owns the data plane systems used for both customer-facing services such as NAT Gateway, Elastic File System, Load Balancers, AWS service endpoints as well as many internal AWS services. This is a balanced team of senior and junior engineers that has proven it can deliver very important features for our customers. You may have heard of us as Big Mac (https://w.amazon.com/index.php/BigMac). We are changing what networking can do for our internal and external customers, having delivered the networking components for Elastic File System and launching the NAT Gateway feature for VPC customers.

The Big Mac Data Plane team is currently working on networking solutions to solve many of the challenges of VPC for customers and internal teams. The team is delivering projects for EFS, ELB, EC2, and many other services that erase a number of customer frustrations and enable completely new concepts of inter-VPC behaviors. We are building the next generation of the network, doing so at scale, and raising the bar on testing, deployments, and isolation. We regularly work with many teams in Amazon, especially AWS, and are pushing the bar in the areas of quality, testing, and deployment practices.

With a balanced team of junior and senior engineers and a healthy operational load, this team needs your help to balance the challenges of growing the team, providing operational and technical guidance and mentoring, and delivering amazing features. It's a fun team with an exciting future -- come work hard, play hard, and change the world!

Team tenets and words we live by:
1. Raise the bar
- We will set the highest standards within AWS and the IT industry by being a leader in testing, deployment, and development practices.
- We will take pride in what we build and ensure that we hold others on the team to that exacting standard.

2. Exceed customer expectations
- We will maintain customer trust in all interactions.
- We will do what it takes to ensure that our products and services are easy to use and work as expected.
- We will solve problems that customers may not know they have.

3. Carefully and meticulously manage our service
- We will look around corners for issues before they become problems.
- We will take the time to understand the potential risks and impacts of any action we take.

4. Drive costs down
- We will look for ways to reduce our costs so we can pass the savings on to customers.
- We will avoid waste in our service and in our individual usage.

5. Execute at a sustainable pace
- We will deliver on our commitments and goals but do not expect to succeed at 100% of our goals.
- We will focus on the long term and not risk our quality or customer expectations to meet short term deliverables.
- We will share our knowledge with our peers and ensure that we have the tools, skills, and documentation to grow the team.

6. Be a team
- We will not be a collection of individuals but a team that gets to know each other and have fun together.
- We will do more as a unit than we can as a set of individuals.
- We will take the initiative to help grow the team and to efficiently onboard new team members.

Your responsibilities will include:
- Innovating and delivering creative SW Designs to develop new services, solve operational problems, drive improvements in developer velocity, or positively impact operational safety
- Writing requirements capturing documents, design documents, integration test plans, and deployment plans
- Communicating status and progress of deliverables to schedule
- Sharing learnings and innovations with your team and stakeholders

Raytheon Technologies (RTX) offers an innovative and inclusive culture; welcoming diversity and collaboration and providing numerous opportunities for career growth.


The System of Systems Modeling & Architecture Directorate is a key part of engineering for Raytheon Missiles & Defense (RMD). This team develops, models, and assesses solution architectures to solve our customers most challenging missions. We are responsible for System of System architecture development; advanced threat assessment; modeling and simulation of solutions within campaign, mission, and system level scenarios; assessment and evaluation of solution performance; prototyping and evaluation of advanced technologies within solution architectures; advanced Concept of Operations (CONOPS) development and visualization; and bringing RMD solutions to customer LVC environments. Our Systems Engineers use engineering and math skills to define the architecture of the system (the pieces and how they interact), the performance and functional requirements of the system (what the system must be capable of doing and how well), the subsystem design and requirements (what components are needed and how they must perform), and the integration of the components into the overall system.

position: Duo Security Software Engineer Bachelor's (Intern) - United States
description:
Software Engineering Internship

At Duo, our mission is to democratize security. We want to make cutting-edge internet security available to everyone. Do you want to help? 

As a software engineering intern at Duo, you will work as an embedded member of a software engineering team to solve some of the most challenging problems in todays security industry. You may work on building our mobile app, securing the cloud, helping us assess device security, or helping us kill VPNs and passwords. On our team you will find: musicians, hackers, hikers, gardeners, birders, and board game enthusiasts all working together to make Duo the most loved and trusted company in security.  

Our teams are focused on questions like:

  • How do we balance security and ease of use?
  • How do we make strong security ubiquitous, so that organizations of all sizes can afford to be protected with strong security?
  • How do we make security software so easy to use that users dont resist it?

If these sound interesting to you, come join our team. Our people are our secret weapon. And together we build solutions that are easy, effective, dependable, and enduring. 

We are committed to cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and connectedness. We are able to grow and learn better together with a diverse team of employees. The collective sum of the individual differences, life experiences, knowledge, innovation, self-expression, and talent that our employees invest in their work represents not only part of our culture, but our reputation and Duos achievement as well. In recruiting for our team, we welcome the unique contributions that all potential candidates can bring in terms of their education, opinions, culture, ethnicity, race, sex, gender identity and expression, nation of origin, age, languages spoken, veterans status, color, religion, disability, sexual orientation and beliefs.

And if this role is exciting to you, we encourage you to apply even if you dont meet all 100% of the description or qualifications. Finally and most importantly, we are a proud Equal Opportunity Employer.

Does this sound like you?

  • You love working as part of a fast paced team.
  • You can tackle tasks independently in support of your team's goals.
  • You want to actively participate in creating a great place to work.
  • You drive results for the business, while upholding our "kinder than necessary" value.
  • You want to work on a problem (internet security) that has deep consequences at both a personal and geopolitical scale.
  • You know how to code and are currently enrolled in an accredited degree granting program.

Additional skills you have:

  • Deep understanding of computer science fundamentals and software engineering with an aptitude for learning new technologies
  • Experience with a modern programming language or framework (C/C++, Python, Java, Objective-C)
  • A bias toward action and an intense desire to grow your skill set

3 reasons why you should apply:

  • You want to work on important projects that ship to 1000s of customers; no throwaway intern work here
  • You are eager to learn about the ins and outs of professional software development at a dynamic organization
  • You love collaborating with, guiding, and learning from high-performing peers on software projects

Tips to make your application stand out: While academics are a strong signal to us, good grades aren't the only thing that matters to us. 

  • Have a technical side project? Tell us about it. (Previous examples include an intern who built a Pacman emulator.)
  • Past internships are a great way to show how you've made an impact and applied your knowledge to a real customer problem.
  • We love to hear about experiences youve had where youve: learned something new, taken leadership / ownership of a project, helped / taught others, and/or delivered results. 

We hope this list makes what we look for less ambiguous, but its not meant to be limiting! Tell us what makes you unique.

Internship Details:

  • Were hiring Software Engineering interns based out of our Ann Arbor, Michigan and Austin, Texas offices
  • Program dates are: May 24 through August 20 
  • Roles are full time and 40 hours per week, Monday - Friday
  • Generous pay and employee perks

#WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference powering an inclusive future for all. 

We embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think were old (36 years strong) and only about hardware, but were also a software company. And a security company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do you cant put us in a box!

But Digital Transformation is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.)

Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, give our egos a break, and give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) We take accountability, bold steps, and take difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a dedication to equality for all, there is no moving forward.

So, you have colorful hair? Dont care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? Thats cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us!

position: Software Development Engineer Intern - Amazon Aqua
description:
DESCRIPTION

Amazon AQUA, Advanced Query Acceleration, is a new service offering to the Amazon RedShift data warehouse solution. AQUA is designed from the ground up to enhance performance of analytic query workloads. AQUA achieves high performance by using a highly distributed platform built of the latest generation hardware, specialized Amazon hardware accelerators, and advanced caching techniques. AQUA€™s obsession with performance allows customers to experience significantly higher throughput accelerating their ability to answer business questions with more data.
To explore more about Amazon AQUA, visit https://www.zdnet.com/article/amazon-redshift-turns-aqua .

We are looking for software engineers who have experience with C++, a good understanding of modern data structures and algorithms and has experience with distributed systems or high performance computing with a desire to apply those skill sets to core database engine. The candidate will help participate in design, development and testing of core AQUA query engine architecture including query engine optimizer and extending the query compiler for enhancements targeting hardware acceleration.

Further, we are looking for engineers with customer success focus and the ability to convert their experiences into visionary ground-breaking product enhancements. Finally, the engineer should have the desire to have an industry wide impact and ability to work within a fast moving, startup environment in a large company to rapidly deliver services that have a broad business impact.

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world leader in providing a highly reliable, scalable, low-cost infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers hundreds of thousands of businesses in 190 countries around the world!

description:
DESCRIPTION

Are you excited about cloud computing and exabytes of data? Are you passionate about delivering high quality services that affect hundreds of thousands of users? Amazon Redshift is the leading cloud data warehouse and one of the largest distributed systems in the world. We are building the next generation of data warehousing and looking for engineers to help shape the future of Redshift.

The Redshift team focuses on providing customers the best performance, highest scale and best efficiency. We build and enable Auto Remediation, Auto Tuning, Auto Root Cause systems which continuously improve the usability and performance of Redshift. You will have a tremendous opportunity to touch every layer of the Redshift database core engine as well as tackling large scale and distributed system problems on a daily basis, Check out https://aws.amazon.com/redshift/whats-new/ to see some of our recently launched projects.

Creating reliable, scalable, and flexible distributed services requires exceptional technical expertise, fundamental Computer Science skills, and practical experience building large-scale systems. You should be somebody who enjoys working on complex software, is customer-focused, and is passionate about delivering high quality software. Come join us and solve challenging problems in a fast-growing team with boundless opportunities.

As a Redshift Software Development Engineer Intern, you will help building systems that orchestrate and manage Redshift clusters across the world. You will own code end-to-end from design, development, deployment, monitoring, and operations. In the process, you will be mentored by senior engineers.

DESCRIPTION

Annapurna Labs is looking for Software Development Engineer Interns - Hardware/Device Drivers to help develop the next-generation of data center accelerators. In this role you marry your two passions; firmware design and hardware control. We are looking for smart and motivated students, who believe high-language constructs are awesome abstractions for silicon capabilities. You will collaborate with hardware design and test teams, as well as manufacturing and system firmware, to create some of the finest chip drivers the planet has ever seen. Your software will be used to boot, control, and diagnose accelerated computing systems at Amazon scale.

Candidates for this position should have a strong background in computer programming, exposure to fundamental computer science, and a passion for device drivers and hardware-centric software.
Equally important, the candidate must have an ability to multi-task, quickly adapt to new development environments and changing requirements. A successful candidate, can write reliable and maintainable code, build robust solutions to difficult problems, and has the ability to communicate clearly and concisely both written and orally.

description:

Advanced Development Team Software Engineering Intern

Job Description

The Oregon based software architecture team is tasked with delivering a best-in-class software stack for Intel's integrated graphics processing units. We accomplish this by providing solutions for software performance, a thorough validation architecture and graphics driver API extensions vetted through standards bodies and external software partners. Our goal is to drive the vision for tools and higher-level software to provide a best-in-class developer and end user experience on Intel CPU and GPU products

Preferred Requirements

- Knowledge of GPU architecture
- Worked on a functional HW simulator
- Exposure to LLVM
- Understanding of 3D graphics

Inside this Business Group

Intel Architecture, Graphics, and Software (IAGS) brings Intel's technical strategy to life. We have embraced the new reality of competing at a product and solution levelâ€”not just a transistor one. We take pride in reshaping the status quo and thinking exponentially to achieve what's never been done before. We've also built a culture of continuous learning and persistent leadership that provides opportunities to practice until perfection and filter ambitious ideas into execution.

Raytheon Technologies (RTX) offers an innovative and inclusive culture; welcoming diversity and collaboration and providing numerous opportunities for career growth.


The System Design & Architecture Directorate is the central focus for Mission Systems Integration activities within Raytheon Missiles & Defense (RMD). The more than 2,100 employees provide requirements definition and design at the system, subsystem and component level every day in a collaborative environment characterized by respect for the individual, problem solving in a team setting, consensus oriented solutions, and results based recognition. Supporting this mission are teams providing domain expertise and creative solutions in surveillance, naval and missile defense based radar system design, undersea sensor system design, integrated air and missile defense systems engineering, command and control/battle management system design, combat system and platform architecture design and integration, software intensive system engineering, cyber solutions and algorithm development for signal processing, tracking and discrimination systems.
